column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Been on generic form since '03,10/6.25, without any problems, usual side effects; colder hands and feet, dry mouth etc. recently had fluid drawn from knee that showed calcium salt crystals, probably a result from the HCTZ, that can cause "PSUEDO GOUT" (fake gout). Changed to just the Bisoprolol Fumerate today. Puesdo gout mimics regular gout (caused by Uric Acid crystals) but with less frequency of symptoms. Been very happy with results, but if you don't need to take HCTZ, talk to your doctor about changing to just the Bisoprolol Fumerate.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I take the weakest possible dose, some time i take half i find if i take as ordered the ringing in my ears get really bad,and i get really fatigued, my hand get cold and numb often, i wear cotton gloves to bed sometimes to reduce the pain i experience during night made worst during the winter, i also find with alcohol the pain is worst, i am 48 and find no sexual decrease from the medication, but if i miss more the one dose i have tachycardia during the night while sleeping on my right side that wakes me up, benadryl seem to help with my sleep, i also use smokeless tobaco which make cause some of my problems, i have tried other antihypertensives meds but find this one to have less problems, i'm only about 20 pounds overweight and when i when i was working out i had better control, i find i also get overheated easiler if i don't drink enough fluids.

column9: I was on this medication for 11 years.  After 5 years, I developed sever skin problems and kidney infections. column2: smokeyjoe, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
